name: Read
documentation:
Command to read a batch of messages from the Fluxzero Runtime for a given consumer and tracker.

This is a low-level API, typically only used internally in Fluxzero by client-side tracking mechanisms or in advanced Fluxzero projects to support external consumers.

fields.name: clientControlledIndex
fields.documentation: If {@code true}, indicates the client manages its own position/index.

fields.name: consumer
fields.documentation: The logical name of the consumer performing the read.

fields.name: filterMessageTarget
fields.documentation: If {@code true}, filters out messages not targeted to this client or tracker.

fields.name: ignoreSegment
fields.documentation: If {@code true}, disables segment-based filtering, allowing access to all segments.

fields.name: lastIndex
maxSize
fields.documentation: Maximum number of messages to return in a single batch.

fields.name: maxTimeout
fields.documentation: Maximum time to wait for new messages, in milliseconds.

fields.name: messageType
fields.documentation: The type of messages to read (e.g. EVENT, COMMAND, QUERY, etc.).

fields.name: purgeTimeout
fields.documentation: Optional timeout (in milliseconds) after which the tracker is purged if inactive.

fields.name: singleTracker
fields.documentation: If {@code true}, assumes this is the only tracker for the consumer.

fields.name: trackerId
fields.documentation: Unique ID for the specific tracker instance.

fields.name: typeFilter
fields.documentation: Optional filter that limits messages by payload type (matches class name prefix).

methods.name: isIgnoreMessageTarget
methods.documentation:
@return {@code true} if messages should not be filtered by target client/tracker ID. This is the inverse of
 {@link #filterMessageTarget}.
